definition: to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: The inflexible purity of Socrates and his atopia are correlative.
sentences.chinese: 蘇格拉底的擇善固執跟他的疏離感是息息相關的。

definition: highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
